components.readme:
# la-akoma-ntoso

Use `<la-akoma-ntoso>` to wrap Akoma Ntoso content.
components.docs: Use `<la-akoma-ntoso>` to wrap Akoma Ntoso content.

props.name: fetch
props.docs: Fetch content from Laws.Africa services? Requires a Laws.Africa partnership and the frbrExpressionUri property to be set.

props.name: frbrAuthor
props.docs:
The emanating actor, unless implicitly deducible by the document type (e.g., acts and bills do not usually
require actor, while ministerial decrees and European legislation do)

props.name: frbrCountry
props.docs:
Country (a two-letter or code according to ISO 3166-1 [ISO3166] or a short and unique alphanumeric codes
according to ISO 3166-2 [ISO3166-2]).

props.name: frbrDate
props.docs:
Original creation date (expressed in `YYYY-MM-DD` format or just `YYYY` if the year is sufficient for
identification purposes

props.name: frbrExpressionDate
props.docs: Any content-specification date

props.name: frbrExpressionUri
props.docs:
Full Akoma Ntoso FRBR Expression URI used to populate the other `frbr` fields if they are unset.
Setting this is the preferred mechanism for ensuring tradition-specific styling.

props.name: frbrLanguage
props.docs: The human language code in which the Expression is drafted

props.name: frbrNumber
props.docs: Number or title or other disambiguating feature of the Work (when appropriate, otherwise optionally the string nn)

props.name: frbrSubtype
props.docs: Subtype used if the document is anything other an `act` / `statement` / `judgment` / `doc`

props.name: frbrType
props.docs:
Type of document

- For legislation ‚Äì Acts, Regulations, Statutory Instruments, and the like ‚Äì use `act`.

- For case law, use `judgment`.

- For other documents ‚Äì Policies, Memoranda of Understanding, Yearbooks, Press Releases, and the like ‚Äì use `doc`.

props.name: partner
props.docs: Partner code to use when fetching content from Laws.Africa. Defaults to the `location.hostname`.

props.name: provider
props.docs: Provider URL for fetching content (advanced usage only).

components.readme:
# la-decorate-external-refs

This is a behaviour element that decorates external references within an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element by
showing a summary of the reference in a popup.
components.docs:
This is a behaviour element that decorates external references within an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element by
showing a summary of the reference in a popup.

usage.html:
Place this element inside an `` element: ```html {{ html }} ``` Alternatively place it elsewhere and provide a selector to identify the `` element: ```html {{ html }} ``` ### Basic React example ```js import { LaDecorateExternalRefs, LaAkomaNtoso } from '@lawsafrica/law-widgets-react'; const App = () => (
// Akoma ntoso html
); ``` ### Basic Vue3 example ```vue ``` ### Component stories Click [here](https://laws.africa/la-web-components/?path=/docs/library-la-decorate-external-refs--basic-usage) for more interactive examples on Storybook JS

props.name: akomaNtoso
props.docs:
CSS selector for the la-akoma-ntoso element or HTMLELement that will be decorated. Defaults
to the containing la-akoma-ntoso element, if any, otherwise the first
`la-akoma-ntoso` element on the page.

props.name: partner
props.docs: Partner code provided by Laws.Africa. Defaults to the hostname of your website.

props.name: popups
props.docs: If `true`, the content of external ref targets will be shown as popups.

props.name: provider
props.docs: Provider URL (advanced usage only).

components.readme:
# la-decorate-internal-refs

This is a behaviour element that decorates internal references within an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element by marking the
references with a flag, and by showing the contents of the target of the internal reference in a popup.
components.docs:
This is a behaviour element that decorates internal references within an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element by marking the
references with a flag, and by showing the contents of the target of the internal reference in a popup.

usage.html:
Place this element inside an `` element: ```html {{ html }} ``` Alternatively place it elsewhere and provide a selector to identify the `` element: ```html {{ html }} ``` ### Basic React example ```js import { LaDecorateInternalRefs, LaAkomaNtoso } from '@lawsafrica/law-widgets-react'; const App = () => (
// Akoma ntoso html
); ``` ### Basic Vue3 example ```vue ``` ### Component stories Click [here](https://laws.africa/la-web-components/?path=/docs/library-la-decorate-internal-refs--basic-usage) for more interactive examples on Storybook JS

props.name: akomaNtoso
props.docs:
CSS selector for the la-akoma-ntoso element or HTMLELement that will be decorated. Defaults
to the containing la-akoma-ntoso element, if any, otherwise the first
`la-akoma-ntoso` element on the page.

props.name: fetch
props.docs: Fetch content from Laws.Africa services? Requires a Laws.Africa partnership and the frbrExpressionUri property to be set.

props.name: flag
props.docs: If `true`, internal refs will be flagged with in icon to be more visible.

props.name: partner
props.docs: Partner code to use when fetching content from Laws.Africa. Defaults to the `location.hostname`.

props.name: popups
props.docs: If `true`, the content of internal ref targets will be shown as popups.

props.name: provider
props.docs: Provider URL for fetching content (advanced usage only).

components.readme:
# la-decorate-terms

This is a behaviour element that decorates references to defined terms within an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element by
making them clickable links, and by showing the definition of the term in a popup.
components.docs:
This is a behaviour element that decorates references to defined terms within an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element by
making them clickable links, and by showing the definition of the term in a popup.

props.name: akomaNtoso
props.docs:
CSS selector for the la-akoma-ntoso element and HTMLElement that will be decorated. Defaults
to the containing la-akoma-ntoso element, if any, otherwise the first
`la-akoma-ntoso` element on the page.

props.name: linkTerms
props.docs: If `true`, terms will be changed to `<a>` elements that jump to the term definition.

props.name: popupDefinitions
props.docs: If `true`, the definitions of terms will be shown as popups.

components.readme:
# la-gutter

This elements provides a gutter alongside an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element. The gutter contains `<la-gutter-item>` elements
which are linked to a reference element inside the `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element using the `anchor` attribute. The gutter
item is positioned horizontally alongside its anchor element.

For correct alignment, wrap `<la-gutter>` and `<la-akoma-ntoso>` inside a `<div class="la-akoma-ntoso-with-gutter">` element.
components.docs:
This elements provides a gutter alongside an `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element. The gutter contains `<la-gutter-item>` elements
which are linked to a reference element inside the `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element using the `anchor` attribute. The gutter
item is positioned horizontally alongside its anchor element.

For correct alignment, wrap `<la-gutter>` and `<la-akoma-ntoso>` inside a `<div class="la-akoma-ntoso-with-gutter">` element.

usage.html:
Use this element in conjunction with an `` element, usually as a sibling. ```html
section 1 content
section 2 content
 comment on section 1 comment on section 2
``` ### Basic React example ```js import React from 'react'; import { LaGutter, LaGutterItem, LaAkomaNtoso } from '@lawsafrica/law-widgets-react'; const App = () => { return (
comment on section 1 comment on section 2
); }; export default App; ``` ### Basic Vue3 example ```vue ``` ### Component stories Click [here](https://laws.africa/la-web-components/?path=/docs/library-la-gutter--basic-usage) for more interactive examples on Storybook JS

props.name: akomaNtoso
props.docs:
CSS selector or HTMLElement for the la-akoma-ntoso element that will be decorated. Defaults
to the containing la-akoma-ntoso element, if any, otherwise the first
`la-akoma-ntoso` element on the page.

methods.name: activateNextItem
methods.docs:
Activates the item logically after the currently active item. The activated item's `active` property will be set to
true. Returns the activated item. Or returns null if there are no items. If there is no item currently
active, the top-most item is activated. If the currently active item is the bottom-most item in the gutter,
then the top-most item will be activated. If there is one item in the gutter that is not active, then that item will be activated.

methods.name: activatePrevItem
methods.docs:
Activates the item logically before the currently active item. The activated item's `active` property will be set to
true. Returns the activated item. Or returns null if there are no items. If there is no item currently
active, the bottom-most item is activated. If the currently active item is the top-most item in the gutter,
then the bottom-most item will be activated. If there is one item in the gutter that is not active, then that item will be activated.

components.readme:
# la-gutter-item

A gutter item inside an `<la-gutter>`.

A gutter item must be linked to an anchor element inside the `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element
using the `anchor` attribute. The gutter item is positioned horizontally alongside its anchor element.
components.docs:
A gutter item inside an `<la-gutter>`.

A gutter item must be linked to an anchor element inside the `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element
using the `anchor` attribute. The gutter item is positioned horizontally alongside its anchor element.

props.name: active
props.docs: Indicates that this is the active item in the gutter. Only one item can be active at a time.

props.name: anchor
props.docs: CSS selector for the anchor element or HTMLElement in the enclosing gutter's `<la-akoma-ntoso>` element.

events.docs: Event emitted when the state (`active`) of the item changes. Used by `la-gutter` to re-layout its items.

components.readme:
# la-table-of-contents

This component is an interactive table of contents generated from data passed in the `items` prop. The features of
this component are the following:

- Expanding and collapsing table of contents items.
- Viewing table of content items as a tree. Showing all table of content items and nested items if they exist.
- Programmatically filtering table of content items by item `title`.
components.docs:
This component is an interactive table of contents generated from data passed in the `items` prop. The features of
this component are the following:

- Expanding and collapsing table of contents items.
- Viewing table of content items as a tree. Showing all table of content items and nested items if they exist.
- Programmatically filtering table of content items by item `title`.

props.name: fetch
props.docs: Fetch content from Laws.Africa services? Requires a Laws.Africa partnership and the frbrExpressionUri property to be set.

props.name: frbrExpressionUri
props.docs: Full Akoma Ntoso FRBR Expression URI to fetch TOC information for. Only used if `fetch` is set.

props.name: items
props.docs:
JSON value or string value parsed to array of items used to build the table of contents. Each item must have
a `title` attribute (which may be `null`), and a `children` attribute (which may be `null`).

props.name: partner
props.docs: Partner code to use when fetching content from Laws.Africa. Defaults to the `location.hostname`.

props.name: provider
props.docs: Provider URL for fetching content (advanced usage only).

props.name: titleFilter
props.docs: value to filter items by item title

components.readme:
# la-table-of-contents-controller

This component renders `la-table-of-contents` based on data passed to the `items` prop. It provides
the following functionality:

- Search input widget
- Collapse all button and Expand all button widget
components.docs:
This component renders `la-table-of-contents` based on data passed to the `items` prop. It provides
the following functionality:

- Search input widget
- Collapse all button and Expand all button widget

props.name: collapseAllBtnClasses
props.docs: Additional classes added to Collapse all button

props.name: expandAllBtnClasses
props.docs: Additional classes added to Expand all button

props.name: fetch
props.docs: Fetch content from Laws.Africa services? Requires a Laws.Africa partnership and the frbrExpressionUri property to be set.

props.name: frbrExpressionUri
props.docs: Full Akoma Ntoso FRBR Expression URI to fetch TOC information for. Only used if `fetch` is set.

props.name: hideClearTitleFilterButton
props.docs: If true, hides clear title filter button

props.name: items
props.docs:
JSON value of array of items or string value parsed to array of items used to build the table of contents. Each
item must have a `title` attribute (which may be `null`), and a `children` attribute (which may be `null`).

props.name: partner
props.docs: Partner code to use when fetching content from Laws.Africa. Defaults to the `location.hostname`.

props.name: provider
props.docs: Provider URL for fetching content (advanced usage only).

props.name: titleFilterClearBtnClasses
props.docs: Additional classes added to title filter button

props.name: titleFilterInputClasses
props.docs: Additional CSS classes added to the search filter input

props.name: titleFilterPlaceholder
props.docs: Placeholder for search title filter

props.name: appendHtml
props.docs: HTML displayed after item title

props.name: collapseIconHtml
props.docs: HTML displayed in toggle button when item is not expanded

props.name: expandIconHtml
props.docs: HTML displayed in toggle button when item is expanded

props.name: expanded
props.docs:
If true, `item` `children`, and the collapsed icon are shown but expanded icon is hidden. If false, the `item`
`children` and collapsed icon are hidden but the expanded icon is show

props.name: filteredItems
props.docs: Array of items filtered by titleQuery used in la-toc-item to determine with item is shown or not

props.name: item
props.docs: Item used to build the table of contents

props.name: prependHtml
props.docs: HTML displayed before item title
